    API

    Review

    APIs power our desktop, web, mobile, and device applications. APIs are powering all of the applications, as well system to system integrations we depend on to make business happen each day. Each and every business today are using APIs, but what makes the difference is how they are taking control of the production and consumption of APIs across operations in repeatable ways.
    Your company is producing APIs today without optimal consistency across teams and lines of business. This often is the result of legacy practices building up, a lack of API design skills across teams, or a number of other factors. The inconsistencies across your APIs, and lack of alignment with common API practices are costing you money, and introducing unnecessary friction across your operations.

    The Business

    We take the OpenAPI and look at the overall design and structure of your API, evaluating the most common areas in which APIs have been standardized across many different industries.

    We take the OpenAPI and look at the overall design and structure of your API, evaluating the most common areas in which APIs have been standardized across many different industries.

    The name, description, tags, and other metadata about your API.

    Help you consider who will be using your API and what they will need.

    Thinking through what people will be doing when using your API.

    Considering how you will organize and discover your APIs using tags.

    We evaluate how you are managing change across your APIs.

    Ensuring your API tells a story and possesses a compelling narrative

    The Technical

    We take the OpenAPI and look at the overall design and structure of your API, evaluating the most common areas in which APIs have been standardized across many different industries.

    Provide RESTful guidance regarding naming and structure of paths.

    Offer advice regarding how to use your nouns and verbs wisely.

    Assist in making sure each API operation is as intuitive as possible.

    Consider your path, query, and header parameters in our evaluation.

    Ensure that you are standardized across all of your API responses.

    Help you standardize the schema you are using in requests and responses.
